cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi SSE of Port O’Connor, TX and 470 mi SE of Port Mansfield, TX
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the central Texas coast with landfall expected near Port O’Connor–Matagorda Bay area, then slowing and drifting north toward southeast Texas/south-west Louisiana

weather_observation.under_watch: Storm Surge Watch, Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island (storm surge) and Boca De Catan, MX–Port Mansfield & north of San Luis Pass–High Island (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast and adjacent southwest Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with gusts higher) possible from early Friday through Saturday at Beaumont/Port Arthur area; probability of 50-kt winds remains low (≤6%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 4–6 ft inundation above ground level from Port Mansfield to High Island, which includes the Sabine Pass/Beaumont area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated 20 inches expected over the upper TX coast and SW Louisiana, producing life-threatening flash and river flooding around Beaumont.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged flooding due to slow storm motion could disrupt port access roads and rail links.
